channel.title: briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from briefUpdatesBreakingOffshootNL, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Laszlo Krasznahorkai Is Awarded Nobel Prize in Literature
item.description: ​The prize committee said the Hungarian writer’s work “reaffirms the power of art.”

item.title: At the Met’s ‘Divine Egypt,’ the Gods are Eternally Fabulous
item.description: A once-in-a-decade exhibition of ancient deities — many are goddesses — ranging over more than 3,000 years, from monumental statues to gleaming figuri...

item.title: Need a laptop? This retiree refurbishes laptops, gives them away to those in need
item.description: Craig Clark, 79, calls himself the "Tech Fairy." Clark spends his time refurbishing old laptops and giving them away for free to people who need them.

item.title: China Clamps Down Even Harder on Rare Earth Exports
item.description: The move is Beijing’s latest attempt to tighten control over global production of the metals, which are essential to the manufacture of computer chips...

item.title: Pope Leo says faith and love for migrants are connected
item.description: In his first major document as leader of the Catholic Church, Pope Leo urges nations and believers to care for the poorest in society.

item.title: In Utah, a group that helped prompt the redistricting says it's acting on faith
item.description: Mormon Women for Ethical Government was one of the plaintiffs in a lawsuit that could overturn Utah's Republican-leaning map for U.S. House seats. Tha...

item.title: Renewable energy outpaces coal for electricity generation in historic first, report says
item.description: For the first time on record, renewable energy generated more electricity for the planet than coal, a new report says.

item.title: New York Fed’s John Williams Favors More Rate Cuts
item.description: John Williams, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York, is primarily concerned with weakness in the labor market.

item.title: A Breakthrough Hostage Deal, and an Arrest in Deadly L.A. Wildfire
item.description: Plus, Dolly Parton wants you to know she “ain’t dead yet.”

item.title: Israel and Hamas reach initial ceasefire deal. And, National Guard arrive near Chicago
item.description: Israel and Hamas have agreed to the "first phase" of a ceasefire deal. And, hundreds of National Guard troops were deployed to the greater Chicago are...

item.title: Israel-Hamas Deal Is Celebrated in Gaza, but Key Questions Remain Unanswered
item.description: There was widespread relief in the devastated territory after news emerged that the fighting may end, even though many details of the agreement have y...

item.title: World Leaders Express Hope and Relief After Gaza Deal
item.description: Leaders welcomed the agreement between Israel and Hamas, projecting optimism that an end to the war could be near.

item.title: Why Blowing Up Venezuelan Boats Won’t Stop the Flow of Drugs
item.description: President Trump says striking drug traffickers from Venezuela will prevent deadly drugs from reaching the United States. But the major smuggling route...

item.title: Live Updates: Israel-Hamas Deal Paves Way for Gaza Cease-Fire
item.description: An exchange of hostages and prisoners was expected this weekend. Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel said he would convene his cabinet to sign...
